sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: In the self-similarity of the Barnsley fern, the first stem segment has a length of 1 unit. If the contraction ratio for the first transformation is 0.85, what would be the length of the stem segment after the first transformation?
message_2:
After the first transformation, the length of the stem segment would be the product of the initial length and the contraction ratio. In this case, the initial length is 1 unit, and the contraction ratio is 0.85.

Length after first transformation = Initial length × Contraction ratio
Length after first transformation = 1 × 0.85
Length after first transformation = 0.85 units
